alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Oconee; Pickens (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 09 at 11:39AM EST until January 09 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON FOR ANDERSON, OCONEE AND PICKENS COUNTIES... At 1139 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3.5 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing. There have been reports of a swift water rescue in Pickens County, therefore this warning has been upgraded to considerable intensity. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
